page.title: 09LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: In Bovey Tracey we find a lovely old georgian house called Parke.Parke house is owned by the National Trust and is rented by Dartmoor National Park.They use it for their headquarters.Their offices include Reception, Planning, Archeology and Ecology, Conservation and Works. From Parke 7 information offices are run over Dartmoor.The house has been used for this purpose since 1978. Dartmoor was designated Dartmoor National park in 1951.Its the 4th National park in Britain and measures 945 km2.49 people are based at Parke. 10 of these are Rangers who look after the moor.8 people are involved in Administration , 7 in Conservation and Recreation ,7 in ground services (e.g. making car parks) ,7 in information and 7 in Development control (planning).
